entries.title: China COVID Deaths Soar as Estimated 250 Million Infected
entries.description: COVID-19 patients rest in the Second Affiliated Hospital of Chongqing Medical University in China's southwestern city of Chongqing on Dec. 23, 2022. (Noel Celis/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Trudeau Called to to Testify in Court on Gravel-Throwing Incident During 2021 Campaign
entries.description: Liberal Leader Justin Trudeau is escorted by his RCMP security detail as protesters shout and throw gravel while leaving a campaign stop at a local micro brewery during the Canadian federal election campaign in London, Ont., on Sept. 6, 2021. (Nathan Denette/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: Japan Tightens Border Controls for Travelers From COVID-Hit China as Accurate Virus Data Obscured
entries.description: Passengers arrive at the international terminal of Tokyo's Haneda Airport on Oct. 11, 2022. Japan reopened to foreign travellers after two-and-a-half years of COVID restrictions. (Richard A. Brooks/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Canadians Fined at Least $15M for Breaking COVID Quarantine Rules in 2022, Data Shows
entries.description: A sign reminds arriving passengers to quarantine against COVID-19 at Trudeau Airport in Montreal,Feb. 19, 2021. (The Canadian Press/Ryan Remiorz)

entries.title: 28 Percent of Gun Owners Hunt for Food, 31 Percent Inherited Firearm: Government Research
entries.description: A Browning BAR 270 deer hunting rifle, which would be prohibited if the Liberal government’s gun legislation amendments pass in Canada. (Courtesy of Tracey Wilson of the Canadian Coalition for Firearm Rights)

entries.title: Japan Raises 10-year Bond Yield Limit, Signaling Possible Shift in Monetary Policy
entries.description: A man wearing a protective mask walks in front of an electronic stock board showing Japan's Nikkei 225 index at a securities firm on June 10, 2022, in Tokyo.  (AP Photo/Eugene Hoshiko)

entries.title: Near 90 Percent of Canadians Surveyed Support Creating a Foreign Agent Registry Amid Increased Interference from Beijing, Russia
entries.description: Parliament Hill in Ottawa, in a file photo. (Sean Kilpatrick/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: UK Rail Passengers Face ‘Significantly Disrupted’ Trips Into January as Strikes Continue
entries.description: Passengers wait at the barriers at King's Cross station following a strike by members of the Rail, Maritime and Transport union (RMT), in London, on Dec. 27, 2022. (James Manning/PA Media)

entries.title: Moscow to Ban Oil Exports to Nations That Impose Price Cap
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin takes part in the launch ceremony of the Kovykta gas condensate field via videoconference in Moscow, on Dec. 21, 2022. (Mikhail Kuravlev/Pool Photo via AP)

entries.title: Canadian Blood Services Needs Blood, Plasma Donors After Storm Disruption
entries.description: A blood donor clinic pictured at a shopping mall in Calgary, Alta., March 27, 2020. (The Canadian Press/Jeff McIntosh)

entries.title: Tens of Thousands of Canadians Still in the Dark After Fierce Storm
entries.description: A Hydro Quebec truck is shown in an area without power in Montreal, Dec. 24, 2022, following a winter storm in the region. (The Canadian Press/Graham Hughes)

entries.title: Search Suspended for Nova Scotia Fisherman Missing Off Cape Sable Island, NS
entries.description: An RCAF Hercules aircraft scours the waters as members of a ground search and rescue team walk along the shore of the Bay of Fundy in Hillsburn, N.S., in an area where empty life-rafts from a scallop fishing vessel were reported on Dec. 15, 2020. (Andrew Vaughan/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: Taiwan to Extend Conscription to One Year, Citing Rising China Threat
entries.description: Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen speaks during a press conference at the presidential office in Taipei, Taiwan, on Dec. 27, 2022. (Sam Yeh/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: CCP Works on an ‘Industrial Scale’ to ‘Capture Elites’ in Targeted Nations: Ex-Intelligence Officer
entries.description: Sam Faddis (C) ex-CIA and Senior Fellow at the Center for Security Policy, speaks in the Pennsylvania Capitol rotunda in Harrisburg on May 11, 2022. (Beth Brelje/The Epoch Times)

entries.title: Moscow Describes Ukrainian Peace Summit Proposal as ‘Smokescreen’
entries.description: Moscow's ambassador to Belarus Boris Gryzlov (L), Russian deputy foreign minister Andrei Rudenko (2L), presidential aide and the head of the Russian delegation Vladimir Medinsky (2R), and chairman of the Russian State Duma's international affairs committee Leonid Slutsky (R) speak to the media in Belarus' Brest region on March 7, 2022. (Maxim Guchek/Belta/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: South Korean President Slams Military’s Response to North Korea’s Drones, Calls for ‘Intense’ Training
entries.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol speaks during a ceremony marking Korean Memorial Day at the Seoul National cemetery in Seoul, South Korea, on June 6, 2022. (Chung Sung-Jun/Getty Images)

entries.title: Top Virologist Declares COVID-19 Pandemic Is Over
entries.description: A health care professional prepares to enter a COVID-19 patient's room in a file photo. (Megan Jelinger/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Niger Reports Severe Bird Flu Among Poultry, Says WOAH
entries.description: Chickens are seen on a poultry farm in Maradi, southeast of Niger, on March 14, 2006. (Issouf Sanogo/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Two Arrested Over Christmas Eve Pub Shooting Near Liverpool
entries.description: Police officers at the scene of a Christmas Eve shooting at the Lighthouse Inn in Wallasey Village, England, on Dec. 25, 2022. (Peter Byrne/PA Media)

entries.title: World Economy Headed for Recession, Inflation Fight Not Over Yet: Research
entries.description: Traders work on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange in New York City, on July 1, 2022. (Seth Wenig/AP Photo)

entries.title: It Is Time to Demobolize the ‘Defund the Police’ Movement
entries.description: Thousands of people take part in a demonstration to defund the police in support of Black Lives Matter, in Toronto on June 19, 2020. (The Canadian Press/Nathan Denette)

entries.title: Number of Imprisoned Journalists Worldwide Soars in 2022, China Top Jailer: Report
entries.description: Detained Reuters journalist Kyaw Soe Oo is escorted by police while leaving Insein court in Yangon, Burma (also known as Myanmar), on July 2, 2018. (Reuters/Ann Wang)

entries.title: Interior Health Says Remaining Patients From Deadly BC Bus Crash Expected to Live
entries.description: Motorists travel on the snow-covered Cambie Bridge as freezing rain falls in Vancouver on Dec. 23, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Darryl Dyck)

entries.title: Philippine Death Toll From Christmas Rains and Floods Rises to 13
entries.description: Rescue workers help people affected by floods, in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental Province, Philippines, on Dec. 26, 2022. (Philippine Coast Guard/Handout via Reuters)

entries.title: Nearly 3 in 5 German Industry Associations Foresee Gloomy 2023
entries.description: General view of the ThyssenKrupp Steel Europe plant in Duisburg, Germany, on Jan. 7, 2020. (Leon Kuegeler/Reuters)

entries.title: Ukraine Wants UN-backed Peace Deal With Russia, but on One Condition: Officials
entries.description: A Ukrainian soldier throws bullet casings from an armored vehicle near Bakhmut, Donetsk region, Ukraine, on Dec. 22, 2022. (Libkos/AP Photo)

entries.title: China to End Mandatory COVID Quarantine for International Travelers
entries.description: Passengers walk through the Hong Kong International Airport on Dec. 8, 2022. (Isaac Lawrence/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Potatoes Don’t Increase Risk of Diabetes as Long as You Prepare Them Right, New Study Finds
entries.description: A shopper is seen past a sign displaying the price per pound of russet potatoes at a supermarket in Montebello, Calif., on Aug. 23, 2022. (Frederic J. Brown/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Launch of New Satellites to Boost Australia’s Air Traffic Control
entries.description: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket carrying the company's Crew Dragon spacecraft is launched at NASA's Kennedy Space Centre, in Cape Canaveral, Florida, on Oct. 5, 2022. (Joel Kowsky/NASA via Getty Images)

entries.title: Protest-Backing Soccer Star’s Family Kept From Leaving Iran
entries.description: Iran's former national soccer team coach Ali Daei before an Asian Cup 2011 qualifying soccer match between Iran and Singapore in Tehran, Iran, on Jan. 14, 2009. (Hasan Sarbakhshian/AP Photo)

entries.title: Russia Says It Shot Down Ukrainian Drone Near Air Base
entries.description: Ukrainian soldiers fire a French-made CAESAR self-propelled howitzer towards Russian positions near Avdiivka, Donetsk region, Ukraine, on Dec. 26, 2022. (Libkos/AP Photo)
